answers.answer: You should ask your doctor for a copy of your lab results.  Every lab has a different range.  Most US labs range for normal TSH is 0.5 to 5.5. Here is a website that talks about hyperthyroid and what tests you should ask your doctor to do.  http://thyroid.about.com/library/howto/hthyperthyroidism.htmAre you going to a general practioner or an endocrinologist?  If going to a gp you should ask for a referral to a endo who specializes in thyroids (some specialize in diabetes only).  Read the website and if you have more questions ask away.  There a some very knowledgable people on this site.
With a TSH that low you may be hyperthyroid.  Have you been tested for Graves disease?

all the doctor said was that my test was a little of and not to worry about it. Is .19 bad or is it not a big deal. should I ask for more tests. I real don't know what to do or what that number means.thanks,
The range from the lab is .4-5.5 and mine was .19 also at the time I was taking asprin about 300mg could that have made a difference.

question: I am 25 years old and my doctor just got my results back from tsh test she said that i am hyper something or other. My result was .19 is that bad. what should i do now. I really don't know anything about this. The doctor told me not to worry, should I.Thanksjulia
title: tsh results What does it mean?
